blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Dan in 2012 was problematic lmao he constantly made rape jokes, made some lowkey racist comments and was ableist. I get that he...
question: Dan in 2012 was problematic lmao he constantly made rape jokes, made some lowkey racist comments and was ableist. I get that he has changed and grown but to say he wasn’t problematic during that time is a straight up lie. He has also never apologised for any of these things while other youtubers have been dragged to hell and back for saying things that were much tamer. Yet if you call him out, phannies talk about how he’s been through a lot. Haven’t we all? That doesn’t give him a free pass.
answer:
This was in response to an post where I was specifically talking about Dan’s old tumblr blog and phan denials and how people saying they were problematic are mostly doing it for selfish, rather than objective, reasons, but I do agree that the phandom does tend to be overprotective of Dan and Phil, often to the point of infantilizing them, so I want to address the idea of Dan being problematic in his old videos to give my perspective. I think that Dan, like many YouTubers who make comedic videos, has definitely made jokes in the past that would be considered “problematic” by certain groups of people today, but has not gotten the backlash some of his peers have received. However, rather than seeing this as something that Dan needs to be dragged for and apologize for, I think that outrage/cancel culture has gone too far in its assessment of other some other YouTubers, as it has with various celebrities and even figures in history. There are a whole host of issues specific to comedy on this topic, but for the sake of brevity, I’ll stick to my biggest overall issue with the trend of labeling people problematic, which is that it takes statements out of historical and cultural context and judges them by the modern standards of a specific group of people. There is a difference between saying a concept was problematic historically and labeling a person as problematic for living by the standards of that time, in my opinion.

I don’t think Dan’s old videos from 2009-2012 were that out there in terms of his remarks in comparison to comedy in mainstream culture, nevermind internet culture, and when he gained wider popularity and then started targeting a younger audience with the Dan and Phil brand, he definitely adjusted the types of jokes he made to accommodate that fact, and has made a lot of effort over the years to try to be very respectful of the sensitivities of people in his audience, to the point where he is sometimes criticized for avoiding controversy at the expense of being genuine. I definitely don’t think he is as “woke” as some in the phandom portray him to be, a point on which I agreed with an anon in another ask, and if he made some of the jokes he made in the past today, I would really question what he was trying to achieve (I am not usually personally offended by dark humor though), but I also wouldn’t say he is or really has ever been a problematic person. Personally, I am much more hesitant to apply the label of problematic to comedy in general and think it’s much more important to focus on things people do and actions they take when being serious that are potentially harmful (although I don’t think saying “it was a joke” is a valid excuse for everything), but that’s getting into my opinions on comedy and that would be a whole other answer. This is quite a loaded topic and I tried to keep my response fairly simple, so I’m happy to clarify anything if need be.

blog.title: Yo I Comment On The Drama When Shit Hits The Fan
blog.description:
Phandom drama? It's more likely than you think.

.

My ask box is always open if you need a place to be dramatic, share theories, conspiracies, opinions, or general grievances. Fire away, my babies. Nothing is off limits. (Except for the things that are.)

.

Icon by phanniephobic, header by cinnamonnutlester

summary: Fan art. What’s okay and what’s not?
body:
Fan art. What’s okay and what’s not?

This post has no real point and it’s just me rambling so feel free to ignore.

But basically, I got to thinking about stuff like fan art, fanfiction, Fan edits and videos, stuff like that. Things that the Phandom creates and puts out onto the internet with Dan and Phil as the subject matter. And some of it is incredible! A lot of y’all are super talented! But there’s got to be a line somewhere, right? There must be a point that comes in which it’s not appropriate to create something. But where?

Here’s what I think.

If you create something, anything, be it a Phanfic or a drawing or a YouTube video discussing your Dan and Phil opinions, you should create it with the mindset that Dan and Phil will see it.

You want to draw that super smutty fan art? Okay, but first, think to yourself. Would I take this piece of art to a meet and greet and hand it directly to them? Would I be embarrassed if they saw this? Because if you post it publicly online, you might as well just slide it right under their front door.

The same goes for anything. You want to write a multi chapter fic about Dan getting turned into a vampire but instead of sucking blood he sucks dick to survive? Alright, but remember, Dan will see it. If that idea bothers you, maybe don’t write the thing. Or at very least, don’t publish it on the internet.

You want to film a YouTube video sitting on your bed talking in-depth about why you think phan is real? Cool. They’re gonna see it. If you would be embarrassed for them to watch that video, don’t post it.

I’ll even use my own damn blog as an example. I sit here and run a drama/discussion blog about two dudes across the ocean who I don’t know and will never meet. I can only assume they’ve seen at least something I’ve posted. Am I embarrassed by the thought of that? No. I’m just out here sharing opinions. If Dan or Phil were bothered by what I’m doing here, they are more than free to shoot me a message and the whole blog comes down. No questions asked.

So, the moral of the story here, is that it’s okay to create fan works. It’s alright to let your creativity out through fanfiction or fan art or fan videos or whatever else. But not everything you create will be an appropriate thing to share. Because Dan and Phil are real people with real feelings and probably don’t want to see the picture you drew of them 69ing on top of a tree.

So create whatever you want. Make it as weird as you want. But just take a few minutes to really look at it, and think “would I be okay with Dan and Phil seeing this?” Because if it would embarrass you, there’s probably a reason for that. And the reason is that you know it’s inappropriate. And if you post it online, they will see it. So consider that before you post.

blog.name: radical-conceptussy
blog.title: Radical Conceptussy
blog.description: Just a nerd trying to find their way and a 100% proud straight ally for Daniel Howell

summary:
Question is, who was going to lie to Dan at 2:45pm? 🤔
Also, don't lie because lying is bad
body:
Question is, who was going to lie to Dan at 2:45pm? 🤔
